original_definition: 'water-based cooling system' means the components or equipment necessary for the distribution of chilled water and the transfer of heat from indoor spaces to chilled water, where the purpose of the system is to attain and maintain the desired indoor temperature of an enclosed space, such as a building or parts thereof, for the thermal comfort of human beings;
generated_definition: 'water-based cooling system' means a water-based cooling system is a cooling system that uses water as a heat exchange medium, designed to operate at leaving chilled water temperatures greater than or equal to + 2 °c, and incorporates or provides chilled air or water to an air-based cooling system or another water-based cooling system.

‘water-based cooling system’ means the components or equipment necessary for the distribution of chilled water and the transfer of heat from indoor spaces to chilled water, where the purpose of the system is to attain and maintain the desired indoor temperature of an enclosed space, such as a building or parts thereof, for the thermal comfort of human beings;
incorporates, or provides chilled air or water to, an air-based cooling system or water-based cooling system; and
whose indoor side heat exchanger (evaporator) extracts heat from a water-based cooling system (heat source), designed to operate at leaving chilled water temperatures greater than or equal to + 2 °C;
